Html:
Hi everybody,

I'm working on a framework which fully supports TypeScript and which can be used to create single-page applications using the MVVM pattern.

It's an open source project and the download provides an easy to test Visual Studio sample project (just install TypeScript 0.9 first).

What do you think of this framework? Do you have any suggestions? Or are you even interested in providing packages or help developing it?

visto.codeplex.com

More detailed description:
Visto JavaScript Library integrates KnockoutJS, JQuery and RequireJS (and TypeScript) to provide the programming model known from .NET XAML and MVVM: It is possible to implement views with "code-behind" and bindings to view models, declaratively load sub views from the view's HTML and navigate between pages - all in a single-page application.
